body:
I'm pretty sure there is an issue about this somewhere...

It requires making a "synthetic" filesystem on top of google drive.

If we did that then we could include
- shared with me
- trashed
- team drives

All of which might be interesting.
@ncw Hey, would you know someone who I could sponsor to work on this :) My go knowledge and even more my time is quite limited but I really would like to have this feature
@FlorianLudwig drop me an email to nick@craig-wood.com and we can discuss!
At our company we stopped using team drives, so the feature was not sponsored by us.
It wasn't dropped - it was never implemented
Can you not mount a team drive as root In the google drive type? I have done so before so unless it was removed or I'm mistaken of what you are wanting its already in

If you create a new gdrive remote in the creation process it asks you if you want to mount a team drive instead of the normal root. Unless you are talking about shared folders, and not team drives like I think you are. You simply answer yes and then it gives you a list of all the team drives you are a member of

I think he means he wants to add his google drive as 1 remote but get this folder structure which is what you get with googleâ€™s client on your computer:

My Drive
        |---------Your Drive Contents
Shared Drives
        |---------Shared Drive 1
                                  |-----------Shared Drive 1 Contents
        |---------Shared Drive 2
                                  |-----------Shared Drive 2 Contents

https://i0.wp.com/www.systoolsgroup.com/updates/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/1.png?resize=650,400

@bulls23nt thanks. Yes, that is exactly what this issue is about. And that is not currently possible with rclone - that is why this ticket is "open".

If you are having a different issue, please open a new one.

> If people still don't understand my plight, here is what I wanted rclone to
> 
> > Shared Drives
> > |---------Shared Drive 1
> > |-----------Shared Drive 1 Contents
> > |---------Shared Drive 2
> > |-----------Shared Drive 2 Contents
> > |----------Shared Drive3
> > |-------------Shared Drive 3 Contents
> > and so on.
> 
it would be the best feature to add. Helpful for people managing many team drives. I use Airexplorer (Windows), MiXplorer (android) and some python telegram bots for cloning and managing files between various teamdrives.
> P.S I know there alternatives available on the internet but many of them are paid ones and there is freemium one which displays ads whenever I open the program

Out of many google drive mounting softwares (for windows) like raidrive,airlivedrive,netdrive,mountain duck,webdrive,cloudmounter and expandrive i've tried , RaiDrive is the best imo. Iirc raidrive started showing ads after September 22, 2020 update, I use the older ver. so no-ads. [This](https://dl.uploadgram.me/6112d242694f8g?raw)

As far as team drives go I had this idea...

It occurred to me that I could make an option for  `rclone backend drives drive:` which would output in config file format with the names of the drives...

I had a go at exactly this

[v1.57.0-beta.5681.c135f93dd.fix-drive-drives](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-drive-drives/v1.57.0-beta.5681.c135f93dd.fix-drive-drives/) on branch [fix-drive-drives](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-drive-drives) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Use it like

    rclone backend -o config drives gdrive:

And it will output an rclone config file configuring aliases for all your team drives.

This isn't exactly what this issue is about but might be helpful.

issue.title: Add new `Combine` Remote

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that!
You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Probably the latest beta (or stable) release has your feature, so try to update your rclone.
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If it still isn't there, here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Search the old issues for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?
rclone v1.53.3-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.4

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?
Managing multiple remotes.
 I use a few google drive + backblaze remotes and it is not quite easy to work with all of them.
Most of the time I want to mount all of them in one particular directory, roughly as follows:
```
rclone mount backblaze:   mount/backblaze
rclone mount gdrive_home:   mount/gdrive/home
rclone mount gdrive_office:    mount/gdrive/office
etc..
# also if mount fails then `fusermount -uz` and stuff
```
I've a script to handle mounting but I think it's better if rclone handles this internally.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?
Rclone can handle all of the mountings as a new remote maybe `combine` or `join`.
So config can be something like:
```
[all]
type=combine
remotes="backblaze: backblaze, gdrive_home: gdrive/home, gdrive_office: gdrive/office"
```
Now I just have to manage a single mount.
As a start I think we should not support nested remotes. And also no remote specific configurations like seperate `--dir-cache-duration`. So all remotes will be leaf in structure and whatever mount config is used for `combine` will apply to all of the remotes.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your feature request. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the ðŸ‘ [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
> As far as team drives go I had this idea...
> 
> It occurred to me that I could make an option for `rclone backend drives drive:` which would output in config file format with the names of the drives...
> 
> I had a go at exactly this
> 
> [v1.57.0-beta.5681.c135f93dd.fix-drive-drives](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-drive-drives/v1.57.0-beta.5681.c135f93dd.fix-drive-drives/) on branch [fix-drive-drives](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-drive-drives) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
> 
> Use it like
> 
> ```
> rclone backend -o config drives gdrive:
> ```
> 
> And it will output an rclone config file configuring aliases for all your team drives.
> 
> This isn't exactly what this issue is about but might be helpful.

Thank you Nick. This helped me a lot.  I didn't know you can mount Google shared drives our team drives as `type = alias`.

For anyone wondering how to use
`rclone backend -o config drives gdrive:
`"gdrive" is the name of your google MyDrive in your [rclone config file](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_config_file/).
And it will output an rclone config file configuring aliases (I didn't know you can configure team shared drives as aliases, very helpful)

Nick, can we somehow mount all remotes at once? mount some or all remotes using one mount command?
If we can wrap several remotes in one named group in the config file, then a single mount command to mount the grouped remotes would be very helpful. [Mount and unmount (in Windows Ctl-C or stop task/service, or in MacOS umount or in Linux fusermount -u)](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_mount/#installing-on-windows) should create and delete each remote's root folder under one mount point.

I have made a first attempt at a `combine` backend here

[v1.59.0-beta.6081.b0c54538b.fix-5600-bind](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5600-bind/v1.59.0-beta.6081.b0c54538b.fix-5600-bind/) on branch [fix-5600-bind](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5600-bind) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

You configure it like this

```
[TestCombine]
type = combine
upstreams = dir1=/tmp/dir1 dir2=/tmp/dir2 dir3=/tmp/dir3
```

I've also added a little to `rclone backend drives -o config drive:` so it makes config which combines all the shared drives into one

With the -o config parameter it will output the list in a format
suitable for adding to a config file to make aliases for all the
drives found and a combined drive.

    [My Drive]
    type = alias
    remote = drive,team_drive=0ABCDEF-01234567890,root_folder_id=:

    [Test Drive]
    type = alias
    remote = drive,team_drive=0ABCDEFabcdefghijkl,root_folder_id=:

    [AllDrives]
    type = combine
    remote = "My Drive=My Drive:" "Test Drive=Test Drive:"

Adding this to the rclone config file will cause those team drives to
be accessible with the aliases shown. Any illegal charactes will be
substituted with "_" and duplicate names will have numbers suffixed.
It will also add a remote called AllDrives which shows all the shared
drives combined into one directory tree.

@ncw thank you Nick, excellent work.  
It would also be very helpful and easier to maintain if we can just add following to the config file:

[All Team Drives]
type = alias
remote = drive,team_drive=ALL,root_folder_id=:

Then, I hope we will be step closer to making the default google drive mount to show 2 folders ("My Drive" and "Shared Drives").  This would be fantastic.
